snippet: Stocks fluctuated in a narrow range as investors waited through the day without an outcome of the debt talks in Greece.
abstract: Stocks resume their slow but steady climb as Greece appears close to announcing a deal with creditors to cut its debt; Dow Jones industrial average ends at its highest level since May 2008, rising 33.07 points, or 0.3 percent, to close at 12,878.20.
lead_paragraph: Stocks fluctuated in a narrow range as investors waited through the day without an outcome of the debt talks in Greece.

headline.main: Possible Deal on Greek Debt Soothes Investors
headline.print_headline: Possible Deal on Greek Debt Soothes Investors
